abstract: Vermont, which once saw Affordable Care Act as mere stepping stone on path to universal, single-payer health care, is now struggling to meet law's requirements; state's online insurance marketplace is still not fully functional despite $200 million in federal funds, and public enthusiasm for long-term plan has waned so significantly that state Democrats have shelved it.
lead_paragraph: Though other states have also struggled to establish exchanges, Vermont, which saw the law as a bridge to a single-payer system, has acutely felt its problems.

headline.main: In Vermont, Frustrations Mount Over Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Barely Meeting a Law It Hoped to Transcend

snippet: Though other states have also struggled to establish exchanges, Vermont, which saw the law as a bridge to a single-payer system, has acutely felt its problems.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
